roleset.name: to choose as more desirable

example.name: transitive
example.text: Although manufacturers often are quick [*-1] to call for lower interest rates , 60 % of the executives said [0] they would prefer that the Fed keep inflation-fighting as its top priority even if that means higher rates .
example.arg: that the Fed keep inflation-fighting as its top priority even if that means higher rates

example.name: passive
example.text: [The sales-tax plan]-239 was preferred [*-239] over an alternative that [*T*-277] would have boosted the state gasoline tax .
example.arg: over an alternative that [*T*-277] would have boosted the state gasoline tax

example.name: all arguments
example.text: Sulzer preferred him to financier Tito Tettamanti , whose secretive raid on the company 's stock [*T*-1] had led to a bitter battle .
example.arg: to financier Tito Tettamanti , whose secretive raid on the company 's stock [*T*-1] had led to a bitter battle

roleset.note: Corresponds to VN classes want-32.1-1-1 and admire-31.2

predicate.note: Frames file for 'prefer' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus.
